titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eveline Mabel Burns Papers

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, manuscripts, notes, documents, student files and printed material relating to social worker, Eveline Mabel Richardson Burns, [ca. 1930]-1985.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Eveline Mabel Richardson Burns (1900-1985) was Professor of Social Work, New York School of Social Work, 1946-1967.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts of books, articles, book reviews and speeches, course materials, students' files, file reflecting a broad range of activities in the field of social welfare such as Social Security, unemployment, health care, and social work education. Also, an extensive file of printed materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Selected materials cataloged; remainder arranged. This collection is arranged in four series:
Series I: Catalogued Correspondence
Series II: Correspondence, Manuscripts and Related Material
Series III: Subject File
Series IV: Printed Material, Student Files and Miscellaneous

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: 1970 M-70 New York School of Social Work Transfer

custodhist.p: Transferred from the New York School of Social Work, 1970 & 1978; transferred from the Columbia University Department of Economics, 1987.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: Boxes 1-99. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Eveline Mabel Burns Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. The RBML maintains ownership of the physical material only. Copyright remains with the creator and his/her heirs. The responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.
